member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectedEventArgs.ConnectResult
member.summary: Gets the authentication result. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.AssignedClientIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the client identifier which was chosen by the server. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.AuthenticationData
member.summary: Gets the authentication data. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Gets the authentication method. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.IsSessionPresent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a session was already available or not.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.MaximumQoS
member.summary: Gets the maximum QoS which is supported by the server. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets the reason string. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.ResponseInformation
member.summary: Gets the response information. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.ResultCode
member.summary: Gets the result code.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.RetainAvailable
member.summary: Gets whether the server supports retained messages. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.ServerKeepAlive
member.summary: MQTTv5 only. Gets the keep alive interval which was chosen by the server instead of the keep alive interval from the client CONNECT packet. A value of 0 indicates that the feature is not used.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.ServerReference
member.summary: Gets an alternate server which should be used instead of the current one. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.SharedSubscriptionAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the shared subscriptions are available or not. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.SubscriptionIdentifiersAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the subscription identifiers are available or not. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.TopicAliasMaximum
member.summary: Gets the maximum value for a topic alias. 0 means not supported. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientConnectResult.WildcardSubscriptionAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether wildcards can be used in subscriptions at the current server. MQTTv5 only.

member.name: T:MQTTnet.Diagnostics.Logger.MqttNetEventLogger
member.summary: This logger fires an event when a new message was published.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.Diagnostics.Logger.MqttNetEventLogger.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This logger fires an event when a new message was published.

member.name: T:MQTTnet.Diagnostics.Logger.MqttNetNullLogger
member.summary: This logger does nothing with the messages.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientDisconnectedEventArgs.ConnectResult
member.summary: Gets the authentication result. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientDisconnectedEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reason code. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientDisconnectOptions.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason string. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientDisconnectOptions.SessionExpiryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the session expiry interval. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientDisconnectOptions.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: T:MQTTnet.MqttClientDisconnectOptionsReason
member.summary: This enum only contains values which are valid when a client sends the reason to the server.

member.name: T:MQTTnet.Formatter.MqttBufferWriter
member.summary: This is a custom implementation of a memory stream which provides only MQTTnet relevant features. The goal is to avoid lots of argument checks like in the original stream. The growth rule is the same as for the original MemoryStream in .net. Also this implementation allows accessing the internal buffer for all platforms and .net framework versions (which is not available at the regular MemoryStream).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the content type. The content type must be a UTF-8 encoded string. The content type value identifies the kind of UTF-8 encoded payload.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.CorrelationData
member.summary: Gets or sets the correlation data. In order for the sender to know what sent message the response refers to it can also send correlation data with the published message. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.Dup
member.summary: If the DUP flag is set to 0, it indicates that this is the first occasion that the Client or Server has attempted to send this MQTT PUBLISH Packet. If the DUP flag is set to 1, it indicates that this might be re-delivery of an earlier attempt to send the Packet. The DUP flag MUST be set to 1 by the Client or Server when it attempts to re-deliver a PUBLISH Packet [MQTT-3.3.1.-1]. The DUP flag MUST be set to 0 for all QoS 0 messages [MQTT-3.3.1-2].

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.MessageExpiryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the message expiry interval. A client can set the message expiry interval in seconds for each PUBLISH message individually. This interval defines the period of time that the broker stores the PUBLISH message for any matching subscribers that are not currently connected. When no message expiry interval is set, the broker must store the message for matching subscribers indefinitely. When the retained=true option is set on the PUBLISH message, this interval also defines how long a message is retained on a topic. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.PayloadSegment
member.summary: Set an ArraySegment as Payload.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.Payload
member.summary: Get or set ReadOnlySequence style of Payload. This payload type is used internally and is recommended for public use. It can be used in combination with a RecyclableMemoryStream to publish large buffered messages without allocating large chunks of memory.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.PayloadFormatIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the payload format indicator. The payload format indicator is part of any MQTT packet that can contain a payload. The indicator is an optional byte value. A value of 0 indicates an “unspecified byte stream”. A value of 1 indicates a "UTF-8 encoded payload". If no payload format indicator is provided, the default value is 0. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.QualityOfServiceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality of service level. The Quality of Service (QoS) level is an agreement between the sender of a message and the receiver of a message that defines the guarantee of delivery for a specific message. There are 3 QoS levels in MQTT: - At most once (0): Message gets delivered no time, once or multiple times. - At least once (1): Message gets delivered at least once (one time or more often). - Exactly once (2): Message gets delivered exactly once (It's ensured that the message only comes once).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.ResponseTopic
member.summary: Gets or sets the response topic. In MQTT 5 the ability to publish a response topic was added in the publish message which allows you to implement the request/response pattern between clients that is common in web applications. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.Retain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the message should be retained or not. A retained message is a normal MQTT message with the retained flag set to true. The broker stores the last retained message and the corresponding QoS for that topic.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.SubscriptionIdentifiers
member.summary: Gets or sets the subscription identifiers. The client can specify a subscription identifier when subscribing. The broker will establish and store the mapping relationship between this subscription and subscription identifier when successfully create or modify subscription. The broker will return the subscription identifier associated with this PUBLISH packet and the PUBLISH packet to the client when need to forward PUBLISH packets matching this subscription to this client. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.Topic
member.summary: Gets or sets the MQTT topic. In MQTT, the word topic refers to an UTF-8 string that the broker uses to filter messages for each connected client. The topic consists of one or more topic levels. Each topic level is separated by a forward slash (topic level separator).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.TopicAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets the topic alias. Topic aliases were introduced are a mechanism for reducing the size of published packets by reducing the size of the topic field. A value of 0 indicates no topic alias is used. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessage.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithContentType(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the content type to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithCorrelationData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds the correlation data to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithMessageExpiryInterval(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Adds the message expiry interval in seconds to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithPayloadFormatIndicator(MQTTnet.Protocol.MqttPayloadFormatIndicator)
member.summary: Adds the payload format indicator to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithQualityOfServiceLevel(MQTTnet.Protocol.MqttQualityOfServiceLevel)
member.summary: The quality of service level. The Quality of Service (QoS) level is an agreement between the sender of a message and the receiver of a message that defines the guarantee of delivery for a specific message. There are 3 QoS levels in MQTT: - At most once (0): Message gets delivered no time, once or multiple times. - At least once (1): Message gets delivered at least once (one time or more often). - Exactly once (2): Message gets delivered exactly once (It's ensured that the message only comes once).

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithResponseTopic(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the response topic to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithRetainFlag(System.Boolean)
member.summary: A value indicating whether the message should be retained or not. A retained message is a normal MQTT message with the retained flag set to true. The broker stores the last retained message and the corresponding QoS for that topic.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithSubscriptionIdentifier(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Adds the subscription identifier to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithTopic(System.String)
member.summary: The MQTT topic. In MQTT, the word topic refers to an UTF-8 string that the broker uses to filter messages for each connected client. The topic consists of one or more topic levels. Each topic level is separated by a forward slash (topic level separator).

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithTopicAlias(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Adds the topic alias to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageBuilder.WithUserProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the user property to the message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: F:MQTTnet.MqttTopicFilterBuilder._qualityOfServiceLevel
member.summary: The quality of service level. The Quality of Service (QoS) level is an agreement between the sender of a message and the receiver of a message that defines the guarantee of delivery for a specific message. There are 3 QoS levels in MQTT: - At most once (0): Message gets delivered no time, once or multiple times. - At least once (1): Message gets delivered at least once (one time or more often). - Exactly once (2): Message gets delivered exactly once (It's ensured that the message only comes once).

member.name: F:MQTTnet.MqttTopicFilterBuilder._topic
member.summary: The MQTT topic. In MQTT, the word topic refers to an UTF-8 string that the broker uses to filter messages for each connected client. The topic consists of one or more topic levels. Each topic level is separated by a forward slash (topic level separator).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.AllowPacketFragmentation
member.summary: Usually the MQTT packets can be sent partially. This is done by using multiple TCP packets or WebSocket frames etc. Unfortunately not all brokers (like Amazon Web Services (AWS)) do support this feature and will close the connection when receiving such packets. If such a service is used this flag must be set to _false_.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.AuthenticationData
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication data. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication method. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.CleanSession
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether clean sessions are used or not. When a client connects to a broker it can connect using either a non persistent connection (clean session) or a persistent connection. With a non-persistent connection the broker doesn't store any subscription information or undelivered messages for the client. This mode is ideal when the client only publishes messages. It can also connect as a durable client using a persistent connection. In this mode, the broker will store subscription information, and undelivered messages for the client.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the client identifier. Hint: This identifier needs to be unique over all used clients / devices on the broker to avoid connection issues.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.EnhancedAuthenticationHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for AUTH packets. This can happen when connecting or at any time while being already connected. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.KeepAlivePeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the keep alive period. The connection is normally left open by the client so that is can send and receive data at any time. If no data flows over an open connection for a certain time period then the client will generate a PINGREQ and expect to receive a PINGRESP from the broker. This message exchange confirms that the connection is open and working. This period is known as the keep alive period.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.MaximumPacketSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum packet size. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol version. Default: 5.0.0.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.ReceiveMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the receive maximum. This gives the maximum length of the received messages. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.RequestProblemInformation
member.summary: Gets or sets the request problem information. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.RequestResponseInformation
member.summary: Gets or sets the request response information. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.SessionExpiryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the session expiry interval. The time after a session expires when it's not actively used. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout which will be applied at socket level and internal operations. The default value is the same as for sockets in .NET in general.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.TopicAliasMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the topic alias maximum. This gives the maximum length of the topic alias. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.TryPrivate
member.summary:
If set to true, the bridge will attempt to indicate to the remote broker that it is a bridge not an ordinary client. If successful, this means that loop detection will be more effective and that retained messages will be propagated correctly.
Not all brokers support this feature so it may be necessary to set it to false if your bridge does not connect properly.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.ValidateFeatures
member.summary: When this feature is enabled the client will check if used properties are supported in the selected protocol version. This feature can be validated if an application message is generated one time but sent via different protocol versions. Default values are applied if the validation is off and features are not supported.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the content type of the will message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillCorrelationData
member.summary: Gets or sets the correlation data of the will message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillDelayInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the will delay interval. This is the time between the client disconnect and the time the will message will be sent. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillMessageExpiryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the message expiry interval of the will message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillPayload
member.summary: Gets or sets the payload of the will message.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillPayloadFormatIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the payload format indicator of the will message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillQualityOfServiceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the QoS level of the will message.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillResponseTopic
member.summary: Gets or sets the response topic of the will message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillRetain
member.summary: Gets or sets the retain flag of the will message.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillTopic
member.summary: Gets or sets the topic of the will message.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WillUserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties of the will message. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WriterBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default and initial size of the packet write buffer. It is recommended to set this to a value close to the usual expected packet size * 1.5. Do not change this value when no memory issues are experienced.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptions.WriterBufferSizeMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the buffer writer. The writer will reduce its internal buffer to this value after serializing a packet. Do not change this value when no memory issues are experienced.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptionsBuilder.WithCleanSession(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean session is used in MQTT versions below 5.0.0. It is the same as setting "CleanStart".

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptionsBuilder.WithCleanStart(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean start is used in MQTT versions 5.0.0 and higher. It is the same as setting "CleanSession".

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptionsBuilder.WithoutPacketFragmentation
member.summary: Usually the MQTT packets can be sent partially. This is done by using multiple TCP packets or WebSocket frames etc. Unfortunately not all brokers (like Amazon Web Services (AWS)) do support this feature and will close the connection when receiving such packets. If such a service is used this flag must be set to _true_.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptionsBuilder.WithTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the timeout which will be applied at socket level and internal operations. The default value is the same as for sockets in .NET in general.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientOptionsBuilder.WithTryPrivate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, the bridge will attempt to indicate to the remote broker that it is a bridge not an ordinary client. If successful, this means that loop detection will be more effective and that retained messages will be propagated correctly. Not all brokers support this feature so it may be necessary to set it to false if your bridge does not connect properly.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientTcpOptions.DualMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the underlying socket should run in dual mode. Leaving this _null_ will avoid setting this value at socket level. Setting this a value other than _null_ will throw an exception when only IPv4 is supported on the machine.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientTcpOptions.LocalEndpoint
member.summary: Gets the local endpoint (network card) which is used by the client. Set it to _null_ to let the OS select the network card.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientTcpOptions.NoDelay
member.summary: Enables or disables the Nagle algorithm for the socket. This is only supported for TCP. For other protocol types the value is ignored. Default: true

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientTcpOptions.ProtocolType
member.summary: The MQTT transport is usually TCP but when using other endpoint types like unix sockets it must be changed (IP for unix sockets).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientTlsOptions.ClientCertificatesProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the provider for certificates. This provider gets called whenever the client wants to connect with the server and requires certificates for authentication. The implementation may return different certificates each time.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientTlsOptions.TargetHost
member.summary: Gets or sets the target host. If the value is null or empty the same host as the TCP socket host will be used.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientWebSocketOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the keep alive interval for the Web Socket connection. This is not related to the keep alive interval for the MQTT protocol.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientWebSocketOptions.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the default (system) credentials should be used when connecting via Web Socket connection. This is not related to the credentials which are used for the MQTT protocol.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientWebSocketOptionsBuilder.WithDangerousDeflateOptions(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketDeflateOptions)
member.summary: Allows the client to negotiate deflate compression on every message, by using the permessage-deflate WebSocket extension. This adds the Sec-WebSocket-Extensions: permessage-deflate; client_max_window_bits header.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationEventArgs.AuthenticationData
member.summary: Gets the authentication data. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationEventArgs.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Gets the authentication method. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationEventArgs.ReasonCode
member.summary: Gets the reason code. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationEventArgs.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets the reason string. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationEventArgs.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationExchangeData.AuthenticationData
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication data. Authentication data is binary information used to transmit multiple iterations of cryptographic secrets of protocol steps. The content of the authentication data is highly dependent on the specific implementation of the authentication method. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationExchangeData.ReasonCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason code. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationExchangeData.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason string. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttEnhancedAuthenticationExchangeData.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. Hint: MQTT 5 feature only.

member.summary: Reason Code is used in MQTTv5.0.0 and backward compatible to v.3.1.1. Return Code is used in MQTTv3.1.1

member.summary: It is a Protocol Error if the Subscription Identifier has a value of 0.

member.summary: Added in MQTTv5.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttTopicFilter.NoLocal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the sender will not receive its own published application messages. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttTopicFilter.QualityOfServiceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality of service level. The Quality of Service (QoS) level is an agreement between the sender of a message and the receiver of a message that defines the guarantee of delivery for a specific message. There are 3 QoS levels in MQTT: - At most once (0): Message gets delivered no time, once or multiple times. - At least once (1): Message gets delivered at least once (one time or more often). - Exactly once (2): Message gets delivered exactly once (It's ensured that the message only comes once).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttTopicFilter.RetainAsPublished
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether messages are retained as published or not. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttTopicFilter.RetainHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the retain handling. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttTopicFilter.Topic
member.summary: Gets or sets the MQTT topic. In MQTT, the word topic refers to an UTF-8 string that the broker uses to filter messages for each connected client. The topic consists of one or more topic levels. Each topic level is separated by a forward slash (topic level separator).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttUnsubAckPacket.ReasonCodes
member.summary: Added in MQTTv5.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttUnsubAckPacket.ReasonString
member.summary: Added in MQTTv5.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttUnsubAckPacket.UserProperties
member.summary: Added in MQTTv5.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.Packets.MqttUnsubscribePacket.UserProperties
member.summary: Added in MQTTv5.

member.name: F:MQTTnet.Protocol.MqttPubAckReasonCode.NoMatchingSubscribers
member.summary: The message is accepted but there are no subscribers. This is sent only by the Server. If the Server knows that there are no matching subscribers, it MAY use this Reason Code instead of 0x00 (Success).

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientPublishResult.IsSuccess
member.summary: Returns if the overall status of the publish is a success. This can be the reason code _Success_ or _NoMatchingSubscribers_. _NoMatchingSubscribers_ usually indicates only that no other client is interested in the topic but overall transmit to the server etc. was a success.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientPublishResult.PacketIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the packet identifier which was used for this publish.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientPublishResult.ReasonCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason code. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientPublishResult.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason string. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientPublishResult.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.AutoAcknowledge
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the library should send MQTT ACK packets automatically if required.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the client identifier. Hint: This identifier needs to be unique over all used clients / devices on the broker to avoid connection issues.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.IsHandled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this message was handled. This value can be used in user code for custom control flow.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.PacketIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the MQTT packet

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.ProcessingFailed
member.summary: Indicates if the processing of this PUBLISH packet has failed. If the processing has failed the client will not send an ACK packet etc.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.ReasonCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason code which will be sent to the server.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.ResponseReasonString
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason string which will be sent to the server in the ACK packet.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttApplicationMessageReceivedEventArgs.ResponseUserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties which will be sent to the server in the ACK packet etc.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeOptions.SubscriptionIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the subscription identifier. The client can specify a subscription identifier when subscribing. The broker will establish and store the mapping relationship between this subscription and subscription identifier when successfully create or modify subscription. The broker will return the subscription identifier associated with this PUBLISH packet and the PUBLISH packet to the client when need to forward PUBLISH packets matching this subscription to this client. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeOptions.TopicFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of topic filters the client wants to subscribe to. Topic filters can include regular topics or wild cards.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeOptions.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeOptionsBuilder.WithUserProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the user property to the subscribe options. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeResult.Items
member.summary: Gets the result for every topic filter item.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeResult.PacketIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the packet identifier which was used.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeResult.ReasonString
member.summary: Gets the reason string. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeResult.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets the user properties which were part of the SUBACK packet. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeResultItem.ResultCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the result code. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientSubscribeResultItem.TopicFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the topic filter. The topic filter can contain topics and wildcards.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientUnsubscribeOptions.TopicFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of topic filters the client wants to unsubscribe from. Topic filters can include regular topics or wild cards.

member.name: P:MQTTnet.MqttClientUnsubscribeOptions.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the user properties. In MQTT 5, user properties are basic UTF-8 string key-value pairs that you can append to almost every type of MQTT packet. As long as you don’t exceed the maximum message size, you can use an unlimited number of user properties to add metadata to MQTT messages and pass information between publisher, broker, and subscriber. The feature is very similar to the HTTP header concept. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.name: M:MQTTnet.MqttClientUnsubscribeOptionsBuilder.WithUserProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the user property to the unsubscribe options. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.summary: Adds the user property to the unsubscribe options. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.

member.summary: Gets the result for every topic filter item.

member.summary: Gets the packet identifier which was used.

member.summary: Gets the reason string. MQTT 5.0.0+ feature.
